metadata.title: CVE-2021-3347 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel through 5.10.11. PI futexeshave a kernel stack use-after-free during fault handling, allowing localusers to execute code in the kernel, aka CID-34b1a1ce1458.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3347` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-141-generic - 4.15.0-141.145
linux-image-4.15.0-141-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-141.145
linux-image-4.15.0-141-lowlatency - 4.15.0-141.145
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-141-generic - 4.15.0-141.145
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-141-lowlatency - 4.15.0-141.145
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-67-generic - 5.4.0-67.75~18.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-141.145').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-67.75~18.04.1').
